intro: Dilepyrum minutiflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered dilepyrum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dark berries as fruit. Dilepyrum minutiflorum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
